PI_name.0: Milan Maksimovic (milan.maksimovic@obspm.fr) and Stuart D. Bale (bale@berkeley.edu)

PI_affiliation.0: LESIA, Observatoire de Paris-PSL, CNRS and UC Berkeley Space Sciences Laboratory

TEXT.0: This file includes radio measurements recorded by the STEREO-A/WAVES instrument. Time resolution varies with instrument mode ranging from 15 seconds to 1 minute.

Rules_of_use.0: Data provided are publicly available. If used in presentations or publications, please acknowledge STEREO/Waves Investigation (M. Maksimovic, PIs). Please read carefully the caveats attached to the data. For reporting purposes, we request bibliography information for any publication, etc., using these data. Please send information on the use of this data to: M. Maksimovic (PI).

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Epoch encoded as Terrestrial Time on rotating Earth geoid, ns since J2000
Frequency channel
1% receiver background of each antenna channel configuration
Dual channel receiver antenna configuration

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: 00 (Off/Off) 10 (+Ex/Off) 20 (-Ey/Off) 30 (Ex-Ey/Off) 01 (Off/+Ez) 02 (Off/+Ey) 03 (Off/Ez-Ey) 11 (+Ex/+Ez) 12 (+Ex/-Ey) 13 (+Ex/Ez-Ey) 21 (-Ey/+Ez) 31 (Ex-Ey/+Ez) -22 (-Ey/-Ey) -32 (Ex-Ey/-Ey) -23 (-Ey/Ez-Ey) -33 (Ex-Ey/Ez-Ey)

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Temporal offset of each antenna channel configuration
High level information about the quality of the electric field measurements

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: All flags are encoded as follows: -------------------------- QUALITY_FLAG = 0, bad data QUALITY_FLAG = 1, known problems use at your own risk QUALITY_FLAG = 2, survey data, possibly not publication quality QUALITY_FLAG = 3, good for publication subject to PI approval QUALITY_FLAG = 4, Excellent data which has received special treatment

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Flag that indicates if the current record is real or interpolated

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: All flags are encoded as follows: -------------------------- INTERPOL_FLAG = 0, record is real INTERPOL_FLAG = 1, record is interpolated

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Power spectral density before 1% background subtraction and antenna calibration

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Suitable for analysis of weak signals

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Power spectral density after 1% background subtraction and antenna calibration

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Suitable for general investigation

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Power spectral density after 1% background subtraction and antenna calibration in solar radio flux unit normalized to 1 au

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Suitable for multi-spacecraft investigation

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Radio flux density [Data available after 03-Dec-2012]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Details on polarization parameters can be found here: https://doi.org/10.1007/s11214-007-9255-6

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Normalized linear polarization [Data available after 03-Dec-2012]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Details on polarization parameters can be found here: https://doi.org/10.1007/s11214-007-9255-6

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Normalized linear polarization [Data available after 03-Dec-2012]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Details on polarization parameters can be found here: https://doi.org/10.1007/s11214-007-9255-6

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Normalized circular polarization [Data available after 03-Dec-2012]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Details on polarization parameters can be found here: https://doi.org/10.1007/s11214-007-9255-6

VarAttributes.CATDESC: The angular half aperture of the source as seen by a spacecraft (uniform profile) [Data available after 03-Dec-2012]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Based on https://doi.org/10.1029/2011JA017333

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Wave vector colatitude in the Radial-Tangential-Normal (RTN) system [Data available after 03-Dec-2012]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: X axis points from the spacecraft center to Sun, and the Y axis is the cross product of the solar rotational axis and X, and lies in the solar equatorial plane (towards the West limb).

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Wave vector azimuth in the Radial-Tangential-Normal (RTN) system [Data available after 03-Dec-2012]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: X axis points from the spacecraft center to Sun, and the Y axis is the cross product of the solar rotational axis and X, and lies in the solar equatorial plane (towards the West limb).

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Wave vector colatitude in the Heliocentric Inertial (HCI) system [Data available after 03-Dec-2012]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Z is the solar north rotational axis, and X is the solar ascending node on the J2000 ecliptic.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Wave vector azimuth in the Heliocentric Inertial (HCI) system [Data available after 03-Dec-2012]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Z is the solar north rotational axis, and X is the solar ascending node on the J2000 ecliptic.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Wave vector colatitude in the Heliocentric Earth Ecliptic (HEE) system [Data available after 03-Dec-2012]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: X is the Sun-Earth line, and Z is the north pole for the ecliptic of date.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Wave vector azimuth in the Heliocentric Earth Ecliptic (HEE) system [Data available after 03-Dec-2012]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: X is the Sun-Earth line, and Z is the north pole for the ecliptic of date.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Wave vector colatitude in the Heliocentric Earth Equatorial (HEEQ) system [Data available after 03-Dec-2012]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Z is the solar rotation axis, and X is in the plane containing the Z axis and Earth, at the intersection of the solar central meridian, and the heliographic equator. When converted to longitude and latitude, this is known as Stonyhurst heliographic coordinates.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Wave vector azimuth in the Heliocentric Earth Equatorial (HEEQ) system [Data available after 03-Dec-2012]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Z is the solar rotation axis, and X is in the plane containing the Z axis and Earth, at the intersection of the solar central meridian, and the heliographic equator. When converted to longitude and latitude, this is known as Stonyhurst heliographic coordinates.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: STEREO spacecraft position in the Heliocentric Inertial (HCI) system in km

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Also called Ecliptic J2000. Z is the solar north rotational axis, and X is the solar ascending node on the J2000 ecliptic.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: STEREO spacecraft position in the Heliocentric Earth Ecliptic (HEE) system in km

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: X is the Sun-Earth line, and Z is the north pole for the ecliptic of date.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: STEREO spacecraft position in the Heliocentric Earth Equatorial (HEEQ) system in km

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Z is the solar rotation axis, and X is in the plane containing the Z axis and Earth, at the intersection of the solar central meridian, and the heliographic equator. When converted to longitude and latitude, this is known as Stonyhurst heliographic coordinates.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Axis Label for Spacecraft Position in HCI
Axis Label for Spacecraft Position in HEE
Axis Label for Spacecraft Position in HEEQ
Vector Representation for Spacecraft Position in HCI
Vector Representation for Spacecraft Position in HEE
Vector Representation for Spacecraft Position in HEEQ
